Game Rewind | Kentucky basketball blasts UCLA

The Cats and Bruins tip off after UNC-Ohio State.

Top-ranked Wildcats blast Tar Heels
UK 84, North Carolina 70: What we learned
Sullivan | Poythress injury a challenge for UK

Game Rewind | Kentucky basketball blasts UCLA

Jonathan Lintner, jlintner@courier-journal.com 7:37 p.m. EST December 20, 2014

Kentucky forward Trey Lyles (41) shoots over UCLA guard Norman Powell (4) as Karl-Anthony Towns (12) watches for a rebound during the first half of an NCAA college basketball game Saturday, Dec. 20, 2014, in Chicago. (AP Photo/Nam Y. Huh)(Photo: Nam Y. Huh, AP)

50 CONNECT 23 TWEETLINKEDIN 1 COMMENTEMAILMORE

Refresh regularly (or click here) for updates during the University of Kentucky's 3:30 p.m. Saturday game against UCLA at the United Center in Chicago.

Final: UK 83, UCLA 42.

More to come...

1:29, 2H: Benches for both sides emptied to chants of "Go Big Blue!" This one's about over.

3:04, 2H: UK used a timeout to get Devin Booker, holding what appeared to be his right hamstring, out of the game. Booker smiled on the bench, though. He's had that sort of problem before and always come back quickly. Today, he has 19 points on 7 of 10 shooting.

4:37, 2H: Derek Willis is getting in on the act now with a 3-pointer, his first points. Now 10 UK players have scored, and the lead is 41 in a game they were favored by 15 1/2.

I keep seeing this photo and it makes me laugh. pic.twitter.com/7eumb5L2IX

— Dr.SicilianoCalipari (@TheErinCalipari) December 20, 2014

Video | UK's Ulis, Booker on throttling UCLA

6:57, 2H: How about Tyler Ulis on his homecoming? The freshman guard has 5 points, 7 rebounds, 5 assists and just one turnover in 15 minutes on the floor.

Ky knows how Secretariat felt in the '73 Belmont Stakes. pic.twitter.com/qTF8enSuGi

— Big Blue Insider (@bigblueinsider1) December 20, 2014

7:51, 2H: At the under-eight timeout, Devin Booker's 16 points are pacing UK, followed by 13 from Aaron Harrison. The Cats' second half hasn't been as impressive as the first, but they've still posted a double-digit advantage -- 26-15.

8:20, 2H: As the beatdown continues -- UK's lead is 67-24 -- the Cats are generating plenty of national attention, including from USA Today Sports. Scott Gleeson points out that UK blocked more shots (8) than UCLA had points (7) in the first half.

Kentucky's merciless beatdown of UCLA summed up by one stat http://t.co/0cBzY99gME via @forthewin

— Scott Gleeson (@ScottMGleeson) December 20, 2014

9:55, 2H: Antoine Walker, interviewed by CBS, said he hasn't seen the Cats dominate a game like this -- ever. But Walker, asked if his 1996 championship team would beat this UK bunch, said yes, of course.

"The one thing that's funny about that...we had 10 pros, too," Walker said.

Speaking of Antoine Walker, a more impressive first half than the one UK had today was the time the '96 team had 86 points vs. LSU.

— Steve Jones (@SteveJones_CJ) December 20, 2014

10:25, 2H: It's a 61-20 UK advantage at the under-12 timeout. Attendance at today's CBS Sports Classic was announced at 19,726 at the 20,500-seat United Center, though the arena will always look less than full with fans from four teams purchasing tickets to the same session.

COURIER-JOURNAL

Kentucky basketball rolls to rout of UCLA

11:56, 2H: It didn't take long for Devin Booker to get going again. On his first trip up the court after re-entering, he hit a corner 3-pointer. Make it 57-17.

Video | John Calipari on Kentucky's rout of UCLA

12:31, 2H: UK's Blue Platoon exits as UCLA is amid a decent half. The Bruins are off to a 5 of 8 start from the field and have already score more points in the second (11) than first (7) half.

If you're watching #Kentucky-#UCLA, at what point do you change the channel? Or are you sticking with it out of morbid curioisity?

— Tim Sullivan (@TimSullivan714) December 20, 2014

15:59, 2H: On one end, a hard-earned layup for UCLA. On the other, Tyler Ulis one-upped the Bruins with a corner 3-pointer. Ahead 49-14, UK's reinforcements are set to check in, too, out of the under-16 timeout.

Tough to watch...I wouldn't wish that half on my enemies. As a competitor i feel for the kids from @UCLAMBB

— Greg Anthony (@GregAnthony50) December 20, 2014

17:33, 2H: UCLA has come out of the locker room and played UK to a 3-3 tie. Too little, too late. The Bruins still trail by 34. But another small victory -- the Cats just had to use a timeout in a loos ball scramble. John Calipari has his other four left.

20:00, 2H: Out to start the second half for UK is the Cats' White Platoon that traditionally opens out of the locker room. By the way, UCLA's seven first half points market a program low -- that's pre-shot clock era included -- on what's already a record-breaking day.

In case you were wondering, #UCLA has returned for the second half.

— Tim Sullivan (@TimSullivan714) December 20, 2014

Halftime: To a standing ovation, UK's Andrew Harrison walked it up the court for the final possession and settled for a 3-pointer. Clank. So, ahead 41-7, at least the Cats have something to work on.

Said John Calipari: "We're trying to play against ourselves, but let me say this: This team is going home for four days for Christmas. They're excited."

Calipari said to expect more Tyler Ulis and Devin Booker in the second half with the Harrison twins getting more run in the first.

It's likely the coach can do wrong in a half where his team missed its final five shots but still closed the first half on a 7-0 run.

See a box score: http://bit.ly/1v6kT8P

Kentucky forced eight turnovers, blocked eight shots, held UCLA to 3 of 37 shooting (8.1%) and 0 for 9 from three. Drive home safely, y'all.

— Kyle Tucker (@KyleTucker_CJ) December 20, 2014

3:20, 1H: Good luck to the rest of the country. UCLA played a decent defensive set and pushed Karl-Anthony Towns out near the elbow. No problem for Towns, who squared up and hit the jumper. Make it 36-7 Cats.

4:57, 1H: As CBS' announcing team discussed the merits of a college basketball mercy rule, UCLA checked in a player named Wanaah Bail. How fitting.

It's 34-6, with Aaron Harrison (11 points) and Devin Booker (10 points) leading the way for UK.

“@GoodmanESPN: I wish Kentucky was playing New Jersey Institute of Technology instead of UCLA.” So does UCLA.

— Pat Forde (@YahooForde) December 20, 2014

6:10, 1H: Not on the trip and out with his torn ACL, Alex Poythress tweeted, simply, "This is bad" with the Cats up 31-4.

This is bad. 👀

— Alex Poythress (@AlexTheGreat22) December 20, 2014

7:41, 1H: John Calipari is still rotating in his platoons despite two fouls on Devin Booker. Marcus Lee picked up his second as well into the under-eight timeout, called for a push when he nabbed an offensive rebound.

The boards are the only place UCLA's kept up with UK. Trailing 28-2, the Bruins' have a 17-16 rebounding edge.

I'm impressed that Kentucky fans still have the gusto to boo foul calls up 28-2 with 7:41 to go in the first half. Strong work.

— Kyle Tucker (@KyleTucker_CJ) December 20, 2014

8:29, 1H: Mark down another accomplishment for UK's defense -- a shot clock violation. It's a 28-2 Cats lead as UCLA works a four-minute scoring drought.

11:24, 1H: Karl-Anthony Towns met a UCLA shot at its peak and threw it into the stands. Walking off the floor to the under-12 timeout, he shook his head while saying, "No, no, no."

The Bruins have done nearly nothing in this one, an even more impressive beginning than what ended up a total UK route of top-five foe Kansas earlier this season. It's a 26-2 Cats lead in Chicago.

Kentucky...My God....35 yrs of being Courtside at college basketball games and don't recall seeing anything quite like this...

— Michael Wilbon (@RealMikeWilbon) December 20, 2014

12:17, 1H: Finally. On a difficult Kevon Looney layup, UCLA's on the board following an 0 for 17 start.

@KentuckyMBB Have NEVER SEEN THIS in a college game that I can recall. 24-0 after 7.5 mins #CBSSportsClassic#BBN

— Clark Kellogg (@ClarkKelloggCBS) December 20, 2014

13:06, 1H: Two 3-pointers later, this is an absolute rout. Devin Booker hit them both, then added a runaway dunk. The second 3-pointer came on a smooth Tyler Ulis assist, which made the Chicago product's hometown crowd howl. It's 24-0. Wow.

Keep in mind, the second half is when UCLA was gonna be in trouble. No depth. Bruins down 24 to start, this could be a (bigger) bloodbath.

— Kyle Tucker (@KyleTucker_CJ) December 20, 2014

14:05, 1H: UCLA still hasn't scored, but with the White Platoon on the floor, neither has UK. The Cats have missed their last four attempts, as the lead stands at 16-0.

15:50, 1H: Enter the second platoon. Aaron Harrison, who has the hot shooting hand, stayed in with guards Tyler Ulis and Devin Booker.

15:56, 1H: The score remains 16-0 to the under-16 break. UCLA's getting beat everywhere, but what stands out are 3 early turnovers and a 7-2 UK rebounding edge.

Kudos to the UK fan in his UK ugly Christmas sweater getting into the timeout gimmick on the floor.

— Kyle Tucker (@KyleTucker_CJ) December 20, 2014

16:30, 1H: So, UK's pitching a shutout. The offense is hitting on all cylinders. Already, it's 16-0 on Aaron Harrison's second 3-pointr. Timeout, UCLA.

Harrison has 8 points and Trey Lyles 4 to lead the Cats, who have hit 6 of 9 shots. The Bruins are 0 of 4.

TWITTER

Thomas Beisner on Twitter

18:27, 1H: CBS' team of analysts suggested this one could get ugly. Already, it is for UCLA. A Trey Lyles 3-pointer moved UK ahead 7-0, prompting an early Steve Alford timeout.

19:43, 1H: The 3-point streak will live on. Aaron Harrison, on an assist from his brother, opened this one by making the game's first shot.

20:00, 1H: UNC-Ohio State, which the Tar Heels won going away, ended at 3:11 p.m., so UK-UCLA will go off just a few minutes behind schedule.

The "new Blue" platoon (Harrisons, Lyles, Towns, WCS) have not hit a 3 this year. But, they hit 74% on their 2's. #BBN

— Cards & Cats Stats (@CardsCatsStats) December 20, 2014

PREGAME: It's the CBS Sports Classic, and there's no mistaking which teams are playing in a Saturday doubleheader. Giant logos cover four corners of the court at the United Center -- UK and North Carolina at one end and UCLA and Ohio State at the other.

    While tipoff between the Cats and bruins is set for 3:30 p.m., it'll likely be later with the Buckeyes and Tar Heels finishing up beforehand. When we get a time, we'll relay it.

    For now, check out some pregame reading: a preview featuring Chicago product Tyler Ulius (http://cjky.it/1APQfVF), a John Calipari Q&A (http://cjky.it/1AqHjb6) and more story lines (http://cjky.it/1vbJDxu).

    — Kyle Tucker (@KyleTucker_CJ) December 20, 2014
